title: Clique synchronize problems: "retrieved hash chain is invalid"
body:
Hi!

We found out some problems while restarting the geth node in our very small local Clique-blockchain configuration.

While looking for most updated and stable version to use we discover some have problems to synchronize what a previous execution leaves in disk-database. 

It is not a surprised these happens on unstable branch, but it took our attention that last versions from 1.8 branch.

We are including below:
 * a short report of versions tested with the test result
 * the tail output of each failure with default login
 * full-log for version 1.9.0-unstable-555b3652 (master's head right now) with verbosity-9
 * full-log for version 1.9.0-unstable-555b3652 (master's head right now) with verbosity-9 after debug.setHead("0x0")
 * the complete files the node access 

#### System information
OS & Version: Linux

We tested this in:
    $ lsb_release -a
    No LSB modules are available.
    Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
    Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
    Release:	18.04
    Codename:	bionic


#### Geth versions

Versions (see crash or no-sync output below):
 * 1.8.13: ok!
 * 1.8.15: ok!
 * 1.8.16: ok!
 * 1.8.17: ok!
 * 1.8.18: ok!
 * 1.8.19: crash
 * 1.8.22  (1.8.22-stable-7fa3509e): crash 
 * 1.8.22h (head 1.8 branch 12-feb-2019): crash 
 * 1.9 (1.9.0-unstable-7c60d0a6):  no-sync
 * 1.9 (1.9.0-unstable-555b3652):  no-sync

#### Expected behaviour

Node execution is restored and node's blockchain gets synchronized.

#### Actual behaviour

Node execution can't be restored or node's blockchain can't get synchronized.

### Backtrace

 * 1.8.19: crash:

````
$ ../bin/geth1819 --datadir ./ --syncmode 'full' --port 30300 -rpc --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpcport 8500 --rpcapi 'personal,db,eth,net,web3,txpool,debug,miner' --networkid 1516 --gasprice '1' -unlock 'd420edf4fa977a82872a9fba2752065562d1ed74'  --password temppwd.txt --bootnodes 'enode://f1ff309f8a0b64674d1674d9d9758204560382857d357b8d1343a395b32d0612597dc2cf7abcb3a1d421e1a817ec482fc636d232e7925d08938540619bc61629@10.10.0.77:30299'
INFO [02-13|17:37:54.680] Maximum peer count                       ETH=25 LES=0 total=25
````

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

 1. setup an small (three or four nodes) clique blockchain
 1. stop one node execution
 1. restart the node.

#### More information
 * [1.9-unstable verbosity 9 logs](https://gist.github.com/tenuki/0757064d4e31d2285bf8f5748d036538)
 * [testnet files](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-wCXnsryjXQB7pQOXCqOwkXiq9U2uSl1/view?usp=sharing)

same for me. The versions over 1.8.21 give random "Bad block" errors and stop synchonize.
The bad blocks are incorrect hash or incorrect gas. 
Note that validators nodes doesn't hang.
I don't know if it's true or false currently for this kind of problems. Blocking can be connected to both options, gas and hashing.

> same for me. The versions over 1.8.21 give random "Bad block" errors and stop synchonize.
> The bad blocks are incorrect hash or incorrect gas.
> Note that validators nodes doesn't hang.

Here it happens to validator nodes too. Not that the nodes hangs by themselves but if you stop them you can't resume them.
same issue on 1.8.22, downgrade to 1.8.17 works for me

I did have same issue on Ubuntu 16.04
I upgraded geth to `1.8.23+build17682+xenial` from `1.8.14`
My problem is solved.
The same issue on Ubuntu 16.04 with the 1.8.22-stable version. It happens to validator nodes. The other nodes hang by themselves but if you stop them you can't resume them.
This has been fixed, both on stable (1.8)  recent release(s) and on master.
